The answer is A: By using highlighting and tooltips for visibility, and enabling pseudo-threading for performance; all three are shown enabled in General Options.
In the provided video, at approximately 00:03:53.124, the presenter mentions that they have enabled highlighting and tooltips for visibility, as well as enabling pseudo-threading for performance. These settings are then confirmed in the General Options screen, which displays all three options enabled. This indicates that these settings are used to make replacements visible while maintaining performance.
